SEARCH
程序包 sort.algorithm

类 SelectionSort

java.lang.Object
sort.algorithm.SelectionSort
所有已实现的接口:
SortAlgorithm
public final class SelectionSort extends Object implements SortAlgorithm
This class implements the Selection Sort algorithm, which is a simple sorting algorithm that works by repeatedly finding the minimum element from the unsorted part of the array and swapping it with the first unsorted element.

  • 方法详细资料

    • sort

      public void sort(Object[] array, int startIndex, int endIndex, int aix)
      Sorts the given array in the given range, using the given axis value. The axis value is used to control the sorting order, and 0 represents ascending order and 1 represents descending order.
      指定者:
      sort 在接口中 SortAlgorithm
      参数:
      array - The input array to be sorted.
      startIndex - The starting index of the array to sort.
      endIndex - The ending index of the array to sort.
      aix - The axis value to control the sorting order.
      抛出:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array is null, if the array is empty, if the range is invalid, if the axis value is invalid, or if the array contains null elements.

    • sort

      public void sort(float[] array, int startIndex, int endIndex, int aix)
      Sorts the given float array using the Selection Sort algorithm.

      This implementation takes a float array, a starting index, an ending index, and an axis value as parameters. It first checks if the array is null or if the range given is invalid. If the array is valid, it implements the Selection Sort algorithm. The algorithm works by repeatedly finding the minimum element (considering ascending order) or maximum element (considering descending order) from unsorted part and putting it at the beginning of the sorted part.

      指定者:
      sort 在接口中 SortAlgorithm
      参数:
      array - the float array to be sorted
      startIndex - the starting index of the sort range
      endIndex - the ending index of the sort range
      aix - the axis value for sorting order, 0 for ascending, 1 for descending
      抛出:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the array is null, empty, contains invalid range, or invalid axis value

      public <T extends Comparable<T>> void sort(T[] array, int startIndex, int endIndex, int aix)
      Sorts the given array of objects using the Selection Sort algorithm.

      This implementation takes an array, a start index, an end index, and an axis value as parameters. It first checks if the array is null or if the range given is invalid. If the array is valid, it implements the Selection Sort algorithm. The algorithm works by repeatedly finding the minimum element (considering ascending order) or maximum element (considering descending order) from unsorted part and putting it at the beginning of the sorted part.

      指定者:
      sort 在接口中 SortAlgorithm
      参数:
      array - the array to be sorted
      startIndex - the starting index of the array
      endIndex - the ending index of the array
      aix - the axis value for sorting order, 0 for ascending, 1 for descending
      抛出:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the array is null, empty, contains invalid range, or invalid axis value, or if the array contains null elements
